name: Old Fashioned
reference: Proulx, Theodore. (1888). *Bartender's Manual, The.* Refers to Columbia Repository, 1806.
notes: Muddle sugar w/ bitters. Build in rocks glass.

name: Toronto
reference: Vermeire, Robert. (1922). *Cocktails: How to Mix Them.*
notes: Muddle sugar w/ fernet. Build in rocks glass.

name: Oaxaca
reference: Ward, Phil. Death + Co, New York (2007).
notes: Muddle sugar w/ bitters. Build in rocks glass.

name: Mint Julep
notes: Muddle mint w/ syrup in julep cup. Add bourbon. Swizzle & top w/ pebble ice. Garnish w/ 3 mint sprigs garnish.

name: Improved Whiskey Cocktail
notes: Strain into rocks glass w/ large cube.

name: Hearn's
reference: McGarry, Jack. The Dead Rabbit, New York (2007).

name: Sazerac
reference: Boothby, William. (1908). *World's Drinks and How to Mix Them.*
notes: Muddle sugar w/ bitters. Add whiskey and ice. Stir, strain into rocks glass. Express lemon twist & discard.

name: Carthusian
notes: Express lemon twist & discard.

name: Boulevardier
reference: McElhone, Harry. (1922). *ABC of Mixing Cocktails.* Gwynne, Erskine (creator).
notes: Coupe or rocks glass w/ ice.

name: Old Pal
reference: McElhone, Harry. (1922). *ABC of Mixing Cocktails.* Robertson, Sparrow (creator).

name: Left Hand
reference: Ross, Sam (2007). Milk & Honey, New York.

name: Algonquin
notes: Stir, serve up.

name: Field Cocktail
reference: Meehan, Jim. (2010. Spring). "Tribute to Colin Peter Field, (manager), Hemingway Bar, Ritz Hotel, Paris."
notes: Pineapple leaf.

name: Blinker
reference: Duffy, Patrick Gavin. (1934). *Official Mixer’s Manual, The.*

name: Monte Carlo
reference: Embury, David. (1948). *Fine Art of Mixing Drinks, The.*
notes: Shaken. Rocks glass w/ ice.

name: Dead Rabbit's Whiskey Cocktail
reference: Muldoon, Sean; McGarry, Jack; Schaffer, Ben. (2015). *Dead Rabbit Drinks Manual, The.*

name: Diamondback
reference: Saucier, Ted. (1951). *Bottoms Up.* Lord Baltimore Hotel, Baltimore.

name: Revolver
reference: Santer, Joe. (2007). Bourbon and Branch, New York.

name: Harvest Moon
reference: Eun, Daniel. (2007, Winter). PDT, New York.

name: Shruff’s End
reference: Ward, Phil. Death + Co, New York (2008).
notes: Coupe.

name: Rob Roy
reference: *Cocktail Book, The: A Sideboard Manual for Gentlemen.* (1900). Old Waldorf Hotel bar.

name: Smoky Grove
notes: For orange bitters, use 1/2 Fee Brothers, 1/2 Regan's.

name: Dead Rabbit
reference: Muldoon, Sean. (2016). [Dead Rabbit](http://www.deadrabbitnyc.com), New York City

name: Waldorf
reference: Crockett, A. S. (1935). *Old Waldorf-Astoria Bar Book, The.*

name: Vieux Carre
reference: Arthur, Stanley Clisby. (1937). *Famous New Orleans Drinks.* Bergeron, Walter (bartender), Hotel Monteleone, New Orleans.
notes: Build in-glass.

name: De La Louisiane
reference: Arthur, Stanley Clisby. (1937). *Famous New Orleans Drinks.*

name: Remember the Maine
reference: Baker, Jr, Charles H. (1937). *The Gentleman's Companion: An Exotic Drinking Book.*

name: Fourth Regiment
reference: Baker, Jr, Charles H. (1937). *The Gentleman's Companion: An Exotic Drinking Book.*

name: Red Hook
reference: Siegal, T. J. (c. 2000). Milk & Honey, New York.

name: Armistice
reference: Hakkinen, Erik. (c. 2000). Zig Zag Café, Seattle.

name: Conference
reference: Miller, Brian. (2008). Death & Co. New York.

name: Modern Manhattan
notes: Altier, Marshall. (2012). Jbird. New York.

name: Bushwick
reference: Ward, Phil. (c. 2000s). Death + Company, New York.
notes: No garnish.

name: Tuxedo
notes: Modern take: use 2 1/4 oz gin, 3/4 oz vermouth, and add 2 dashes orange bitters.

name: Gibson
reference: Boothby, William. (1908). _World's Drinks and How to Mix Them._
notes: Garnish with a cocktail onion.

name: Bronx
reference: Boothby, William. (1908). *World's Drinks and How to Mix Them.* Solon, Johnnie (bartender). Big Brass Rail, Waldorf-Astoria Hotel, New York.

name: Hanky Panky
reference: Craddock, Harry. (1930). *Savoy Cocktail Book, The.* Coleman, Ada (bartender), Savoy Hotel Bar (1902–26), London.

name: Lucien Gaudin
reference: Haign, Ted. (2009). _Vintage Spirits and Forgotten Cocktails._ Anonymous (bartender), c. 1930.

name: Dorflinger
reference: Crockett, A. S. (1935). *Old Waldorf-Astoria Bar Book, The.*

name: Caprice
reference: Gale, Hyman, Marco, Abe. (1940). *The How & When*

name: Negroni
notes: Coupe or rocks glass w/ ice.

name: White Negroni
notes: Can use Salers or Gran Classico for the aperitivo and Lillet Blanc for the aperitif.

name: Charente White Negroni
reference: Lataille, Matthias; Difford, Simon. (2014). Cabinet Room, London.

name: Kingston Negroni
reference: Simo, Joaquin. (2009). Death & Company, New York.
notes: Coupe or rocks glass w/ ice.

name: Mezcal Negroni
notes: Coupe or rocks glass w/ ice. Can use 4 drops of saline solution instead of salt.

name: Mustachioid
notes: Can substitute with Cynar and Gran Classico.

name: Obituary
reference: Anonymous. (n.d.). Lafitte's Blacksmith Shop Bar, New Orleans.

name: Dreamy Dorini Smoky Martini
notes: Build in glass.

name: Berlioni
reference: de Sousa Monteiro, Gonçalo. (2004). Victoria Bar, Berlin.
notes: Stir, strain into rocks w/ 1 large cube.

name: Yeoman Warder
notes: Coupe.

name: The Joy Division
notes: Coupe.

name: Cynartown
reference: Ward, Phil. Death + Company, New York.

name: Grand Street
reference: Day, Alex. Death + Co, New York (2009).
notes: Coupe. Muddle the grapefruit peel before stirring.

name: Bumbo
reference: Washington, George. (1758). Presidential campaign. Anonymous (creator), pirates, c. 1600.
notes: Build in rocks glass w/ ice.

name: Stinger
notes: Shaken.

name: Savoy Tango
notes: Shaken.

name: French Connection
notes: Build in-glass.

name: Newark
reference: Meehan, Jim, & Deragon, John. (2007, Fall). PDT, New York.

name: Nth Degree
reference: Dumas, Nate. (2008, Winter). PDT, New York
notes: Muddle sugar w/ bitters. Add rest, stir, strain into rocks glass.

name: Augie March
notes: Coupe.

name: Improved Tequila Cocktail
reference: Heugel, Bobby. (2011). Anvil Bar & Refuge, Houston, TX.

name: As One Does
notes: Crushed ice, swizzle. Garnish with mint.

name: Reggatta de Blanc
notes: Stir into rocks w/ ice. Garnish with grapes.

name: Maximilano
reference: Xoxocotla, Julio. (2015). Ward III, New York
notes: Pinch salt. Stir into rocks w/ ice.

name: Terrible Love
notes: Rocks.

name: Flying Dutchman
reference: Meehan, Jim. (2009, Winter). PDT, New York.

name: 20th Century
reference: Tarling, W. J. (1937). *Café Royale Cocktail Book.*

name: 21st Century
reference: Meehan, Jim. (2007). Pegu Club, New York.

name: Jubilant
reference: Perosino, J. (Tarling, W. J.). Café Royal Cocktail Book.
notes: Coupe.

name: Army & Navy
reference: Embury, David. (1948). *Fine Art of Mixing Drinks, The.*
notes: shaken.

name: The Last Word
reference: Saucier, Ted. (1951). *Bottoms Up.* Detroit Athletic Club, Detroit. Stenson, Murray (bartender, rediscovered), Zig Zag Café, Seattle.

name: Final Ward
reference: Ward, Phil. (c. 2000s). Death + Company, New York.

name: May Daisy
reference: Ward, Phil. (2007, Summer). Death + Company, New York.
notes: White wine glass w/ ice.

name: Chingon
reference: Miller, Brian. Death + Co, New York (2009).
notes: Coupe.

name: Cherry Pop
notes: Muddle cherries w/ sugar. Strain into rocks glass w/ pebble ice.

name: That Green Drink
notes: Muddle 2 cucumber slices with the syrup. Add a long cucumber peel for garnish.

name: Brandy Crusta
notes: Stir and strain into a chilled, sugar-rimmed wine glass filled with an entire lemon and orange peel.

name: Ward Eight
reference: *Cocktail Book, The: A Sideboard Manual for Gentlemen.* (1900).

name: Gold Rush
reference: Siegal, T. J. (c. 2000). Milk & Honey, New York.
notes: Rocks glass w/ large cube.

name: Jack Rose
reference: Boothby, William. (1908). *World's Drinks and How to Mix Them.*

name: Sidecar
reference: Vermeire, Robert. (1922). *Cocktails: How to Mix Them.*

name: Scofflaw
notes: Pinch of salt.

name: Twelve Mile Limit
reference: Haigh, Ted. (2009). *Vintage Spirits and Forgotten Cocktails.* Fairfax Millard, Thomas Franklin (creator), 1934.

name: Pimms Cup
reference: Beebe, Lucius, (1946). *Stork Club Bar Book, The*
notes: Muddle cucumber w/ syrup. Add rest, shake, strain into Collins glass w/ ice.

name: Charlie Chaplin
reference: Embury, David. (1948). *Fine Art of Mixing Drinks, The.*

name: Honey Bee
reference: Embury, David. (1948). *The Fine Art of Mixing Drinks*

name: Talbott Leaf
reference: Corcoran, Gerry. (2009, Spring). PDT, New York.
notes: Muddle mint w/ Cynar. Mint leaf.

name: Smokescreen
reference: Day, Alex. (2018). _Cocktail Codex_. Death + Co, New York.

name: Queens Park Swizzle
notes: Muddle mint w/ syrup in Collins glass. Add rest, add pebble ice, swizzle, add pebble ice.

name: Singapore Sling
reference: *Sloppy Joe's*. (1931). Ngiam Tong Boon (bartender), Long Bar, Raffles Hotel, Singapore, 1915.
notes: Collins glass w/ ice. Pineapple slice.

name: Margarita
reference: Tarling, W. J. (1937). *Café Royal Cocktail Book.* "Picador Cocktail" (orig).
notes: Salt. Rocks glass w/ ice or coupe.

name: Bronco Buster
reference: Saucier, Ted. (1951). *Bottoms Up.* Arizona Biltmore Hotel, Phoenix.
notes: Salt. Rocks glass w/ ice or coupe.

name: Royal Bermuda Yacht Club
reference: Gaige, Crosby. (1945). *Cocktail Guide and Ladies' Companion.*

name: Beachbum Berry’s Mai Tai
notes: Rocks glass w/ pebble ice.

name: Smuggler’s Cove Mai Tai
reference: Cate, Martin. (2000s). Smuggier's Cove, San Francisco.
notes: Shake w/ crushed ice, pour unstrained into rocks glass. Garnish w/ spent lime hull & a mint sprig.

name: Lost Lake’s Mai Tai
notes: Shake w/ lime hull. Rocks glass w/ pebble ice.

name: Corn 'n Oil
notes: Build in rocks glass w/ ice. Squeeze 1/4 lime on top.

name: Pisco Sour
reference: Baker, Jr, Charles H., (1951). *South American Gentleman's Companion, The.*
notes: Garnish with 4 dashes of Angostura bitters.

name: Jungle Bird
reference: Ross, Sam. (2012) Milk + Honey, New York.

name: Caipirinha
notes: Cut 1/2 of a lime into wedges, then muddle w/ 2 demerara sugar cubes and shake, pour unstrained into rocks glass.

name: Barbados
reference: Rathbun, A.J. (2011). *Ginger Bliss and The Violet Fizz*.
notes: Crushed ice.

name: Lust For Life
notes: Shake, strain over rocks. Dust w/ cocoa powder.

name: Monkey Gland
reference: McElhone, Harry. (1922). *ABC of Mixing Cocktails.* Ciro's Club, London.

name: Moscow Mule
reference: Beebe, Lucius. (1946). *Stork Club Bar Book, The.* Morgan, Jack (bartender) Cock 'n' Bull, Los Angeles.
notes: Shake, strain into mule cup w/ ice.

name: Paloma
notes: Build in salt-rimmed Collins glass w/ ice.

name: Ramos Gin Fizz
notes: Collins glass.

name: Seelbach
reference: Haigh, Ted. (2003). *Vintage Spirits and Forgotten Cocktails.* Seelbach Hotel Bar, Louisville, 1917.

name: Mojito
reference: Lasa, Juan A. (1929). *Libro de Cocktail.* "Rum Mojo" (orig).
notes: Muddle mint w/ syrup in mixing glass. Add rest, shake. Fine-strain into Collins glass w/ ice.

name: Death in the Afternoon
reference: Hemingway, Ernest. (1935) "Death in the Afternoon". *So Red the Nose, or Breath in the Afternoon.*
notes: Champagne flute.

name: Jimmie Roosevelt
notes: Shake cognac, chartreuse, bitters w/ ice. coupe.

name: El Diablo
notes: Strain into rocks glass w/ ice. Garnish w/ candied ginger.

name: Old Cuban
reference: Saunders, Audrey. (c. 2000). Pegu Club, New York.
Sharpe, Aisha, & Shine, WIlly. (2008). Contemporary Cocktails, New York
notes: Shake, strain into Collins glass w/ ice.

name: White Birch Fizz
reference: deBary, John. (2009, Fall). PDT, New York.
notes: Collins glass.

name: Lovage
notes: Salt.

name: Fernet Flip
notes: Sugar.

name: Coda
notes: Fizz glass.
